explain_nonmoney: we were given an even number so it is only fair if we split them evenly

I split the 10 pens equally amongst the two of us. I don't really want or need more than like 2 pens but split equally to make it fair. I would later ask if they wanted more because I don't really need 5 pens.
Ballpoint pens are not that valuable to me. It made sense to me to just split them evenly.
I feel like we don't owe each other anything and won't ever do anything together so we may as well be fair about splitting things up. If it were a friend my answer may be different depending on who.
I think it is appropriate to share this time as the task is boring.
I wanted to be fair to both me and this other random participant, so I decided 5 minutes each. I did not want any distributive injustices, so I decided for equality.
I didnt know this person and i would feel bad if i took all the minutes off
i split it evenly so its fair and nice to both parties
I just split this in half to divide the work up evenly
Like the example above I thought it was fair to split it halfway. If we are given 10 minutes of music, why not split the time 5 and 5. This would be a fair decision to split up the time.
I feel like I could deal with searching for the letter E and it would not bore me too much. And stopping to listen to music for not even that long would not be needed for me.
I gave us each equal amount of time off. I thought that was fair and she was friendly.

I split the time evenly because I feel it is the fairest. I don't want this person to feel offended to upset if I got more minutes than her so that is why I made it even. I think we would both be content with 5 minutes.

I decided to split to 10 minutes off total right down the middle, 5 minutes off for me and 5 minutes off for my partner. I decided to split it in half because I thought that would only be fair as we were both doing the same amount of work. It wouldn't be fair if one of us got a longer break despite having spent the same amount of time on this assignment.

I don't know my partner at all other than when we talked before coming in. I think since we are both in the same position of getting randomly put together and we are both participants in the same study it is only fair if we split the 10-minute music time into 5 and 5.
I gave the other participant 5 minutes. This was because there were 10 minutes in total between the two of us. That is the fairest way to split the minutes up.
i feel like it was only fair. this was i could spend half off and so could my partner
Again, if the study was very boring and we both had to endure it, I would rather us each have 5 minutes to listen to music. I feel that this is the fairest way to go about it.

I thought that if we were both doing the task we would tire less from both having time away for the task. While the time was given to me, I didn't think it was fair for me to get all of it while my partner was stuck doing more work.
splitting the time evenly is the most reasonable options. since i do not know my partner, i would prefer to split the time in the fairest way.
it is fair to split it
It just makes the most sense to me for the time to be split evenly between us. I would feel awkward taking more time than my partner.
I split the time evenly so the both of us could have the same amount of time listening to music and also crossing out the e's in the paragraphs.
it is fair that we spend the same time doing the same task
Again, I decided to split the time evenly. I can't really think of another way to do it that is not unfair or rude.
I think that splitting the time evenly is far as I do not want to be selfish. I dividing it is also the best way so there are not arguments.

As college students, pens are useful to us. Maybe I would ask the other person if they handwrite notes more often than I do and split it that way, but otherwise I think it is still reasonable to split evenly.

I would have given more pens to the other participant, but I'm not sure they would need or even want more than 1 or maybe 2 pens for themselves, and I tend to lose lots of writing utensils, so I believe it would be most efficient to split that way. This way I could take the pens off their hands for them.
Not that I necessarily need more pens, but splitting seems fair to me in this situation. When offered an even amount, splitting is always the best option to ensure fairness.
I also split the minutes in half. We each get 5 minutes, enough to listen to some music and relax, then get back to work.
I think the money is more important to split, so I didn't mind being a little greedy and keeping this to myself

i split the 10 minutes because i think it's only fair. it's a win-win situation as we are both getting shorter working time. i also really don't mind repetitive tasks, i actually think i would enjoy the crossing out e's task.
It's fair that we both get the same amount. If i took 7 and gave her 3 it would be unfair of me. If she got 3 and i got 7 it would be unfair to her.
Again, the same reasoning for splitting with the money. If it were up to me, I will choose to split it.
I think that it would only be fair to split the pens won because neither of us did anything more than the other to deserve the winnings.
I don't really care for ballpoint pens, so I split them up evenly between us. It wasn't money and I couldn't sell them so I would give them up.
I split it in half so each of us get 5 pens. I felt that this was the most fair, but if I knew my partner needed pens I would give him more, because I don't necessarily need any.

I chose for each of us to get the same amount because it just seemed fair, I don't need ten pens. Since it's my first time meeting them I don't want to give them a bad impression I also don't know if they use or already have pens
The other person could probably use those pens just as much as me so we should have an equal distribution.
I would give him an extra pen becasue i do not need any. I wouldnt gve him all because he might not need the either.
Similar to the last answer, we just met each other and he was a good guy. I think we each deserve 50/50 in anything we get.
I again chose to split the pens 50/50 as I gave myself 5 and my partner 5 as well. To me it makes the most sense to just divide them evenly.

I feel for something as insignificant as pens, I would not be upset with sharing evenly with my partner, even if I barely know them. I also have several pens of my own and wouldn't need all ten for myself.
Because i dont need that much time and i give it to the other paticipant and it will maybe make her happy
I decided to make it even because if he wanted to listen to music as well. we would have even times, and nobody would be angry at how I distributed it.

I split the 10 minute break in half with my partner getting 5 minutes off and myself also getting 5 minutes off. I did this because it seemed most fair given we did not discuses our reading skills or speed or anything else along those lines.
I want it to be equal. If I were the other person, I would want my partner to make the time equal also.
I chose to split the time evenly. Seemed the most fair. Have no reason to keep all for myself
I don't mind doing mundane tasks. I would rather give my partner more time to enjoy themself, and less time doing a task they do not want to do

I chose to distribute the 10 minutes evenly because that's what I believe is fair. I gave my partner 5 minutes and myself 5 minutes, and I think that is the best way to do it. I don't want my partner to think I am selfish, and I also would feel uncomfortable giving myself more break minutes than him.

I allocated this portion because I do not really need 10 ballpoint pens and I don't think she needs that many either so I split it down the middle. 5 ballpoint pens feels like a decent amount of pens to have.
Same reason as above
i dont need pens so since i kept money for myself i gave my partner all the pens to kind of make it up
Pretty much the same reasoning as above, this seemed easier to split since I don't perceive any monetary value with these pens.
I split them in half because I feel like that is fair for the both of us. I would feel guilty taking anything more and not right to take anything less.
I picked 5 each because it seemed fair splitting it in half. I think 5 pens is a reasonable amount to own
I distributed the 10 ballpoint pens equally between the two of us. I didn't want to be unfair or be selfish by keeping more than the other person so I thought we would just have the same amount.
Since it's an even number, we can split it in half so that its fair.
we are both students and i have many pens at home
Split the time fifty/fifty
I would want to be fair with my partner, so I would allocate the time fairly and split it between the both of us. I do not like to be selfish and would want to make everything fair.

For a scenario like this, people would usually divide the time equally since it would mean that everyone gets a chance to take a quality break. So again, I allocated 5 to myself and 5 to the other participant because I want to ensure I have a break at all.
I decided to give my partner 6 minutes of music. I gave myself 4 minutes. The reason why is because I don't necessarily need music to do a boring task.
I was given 10 minutes so the most ethical and fair way to go about splitting that time would be to split it 50/50. My partner seemed kind so I think she would do the same.

I allocated myself 5 minutes off and the other participant 5 minutes off. I am not sure how the other participant would feel about the time off, so I split it evenly for fairness. I would have gave myself less time off because I don't really care, but I don't know how the other participant feels so I did not.
I gave both of use 5 minutes for each. It is fair, I don't know why either of us would be unhappy

I feel like compared to the money; there is no true loss besides time in giving someone less. So, I split 70/30 music for me. I think that taking all the time to listen to music is wrong, however, in a situation where the only loss is time. I feel that it is fair to take more.

It's someone I just met and an even split seemed to be the most fair. A 10 minute break is too long and I wouldn't get the job done as quickly if I took a long break and someone else took no break at all.
